plants.name: Digitalis purpurea
plants.description: A biennial plant native to Europe, known for its tall spikes of tubular flowers. It thrives in woodlands and open fields.
plants.funFact: Foxglove flowers are shaped to encourage pollination by bees, which must crawl inside the tubular flowers to reach nectar.

plants.name: Lagerstroemia indica
plants.description: A deciduous shrub or small tree known for vibrant summer blooms and attractive, smooth bark. Commonly cultivated in subtropical and temperate regions.
plants.location: South Asia, southeastern USA, Mediterranean climates
plants.funFact: Crape myrtle flowers can bloom for an extended period, sometimes up to 100 days.

plants.name: Rhododendron macrophyllum
plants.description: A large shrub or small tree native to the Pacific Northwest, known for spectacular spring floral displays.
plants.funFact: Pacific rhododendron prefers acidic, well-drained soils and blooms profusely after a wet winter.
